summary.long: 1 Chronicles is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: Adam, Seth, Enosh;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kenan, Mahalalel, Jared;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Noah,
Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Japheth were
Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshek, and Tiras.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Gomer were
Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Javan were
Elishah, Tarshish, the Kittites, and the Rodanites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Ham were
Cush, Egypt, Put, and Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Cush were
Seba, Havilah, Sabta, Raamah, and Sabteka.
The sons of Raamah were
Sheba and Dedan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cush became the father of
Nimrod, who began to be mighty on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Egypt became the father of
the Ludites, Anamites, Lehabites, and Naphtuhites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pathrusites, Kasluhites (from whom came the Philistines), and the Caphtorites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Canaan became the father of
Sidon, his firstborn, and Heth
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Jebusites, the Amorites, the Girgashites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Hivites, the Arkites, the Sinites,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Arvadites, the Zemarites, and the Hamathites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Shem were
Elam, Ashur, Arphaxad, Lud, Aram,
Uz, Hul, Gether, and Meshek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Arphaxad became the father of Shelah,
and Shelah became the father of Eber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Two sons were born to Eber:
The name of one was Peleg, for in his days the earth was divided, and the name of his brother was Joktan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Joktan became the father of
Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, and Jerah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hadoram, Uzal, and Diklah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ebal, Abimael, Sheba,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shem, Arphaxad, Shelah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eber, Peleg, Reu,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Serug, Nahor, Terah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Abram, who is Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Abraham were
Isaac and Ishmael.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These are their generations:
The firstborn of Ishmael was Nebaioth, then Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mishma, Dumah, Massa, Hadad, Tema,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These were the sons of Ishmael.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Keturah, Abraham’s concubine:
She bore Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah.
The sons of Jokshan were
Sheba and Dedan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Midian were
Ephah, Epher, Hanok, Abida, and Eldaah.
All these were the sons of Keturah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Abraham also became the father of Isaac.
The sons of Isaac were
Esau and Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Esau were
Eliphaz, Reuel, Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Eliphaz were
Teman, Omar, Zephi, Gatam, Kenaz, Timna, and Amalek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Reuel were
Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Seir were
Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah, Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Lotan were
Hori and Homam; the sister of Lotan was Timna.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Shobal were
Alian, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho, and Onam.
The sons of Zibeon were
Aiah and Anah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The son of Anah was
Dishon.
The sons of Dishon were
Hamran, Eshban, Ithran, and Keran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Ezer were
Bilhan, Zaavan, and Jaakan.
The sons of Dishan were
Uz and Aran.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before any king reigned over the children of Israel:
Bela the son of Beor (the name of his city was Dinhabah).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Bela died, Jobab the son of Zerah from Bozrah reigned in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jobab died, Husham from the land of the Temanites reigned in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Husham died, Hadad the son of Bedad, the one who struck Midian in the open field of Moab, reigned in his place (the name of his city was Avith).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Hadad died, Samlah from Masrekah reigned in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Samlah died, Shaul from Rehoboth on the River reigned in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Shaul died, Baal-Hanan the son of Akbor reigned in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Baal-Hanan died, Hadad reigned in his place (the name of his city was Pai, and the name of his wife was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Me-Zahab).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Hadad died.
The tribal chiefs of Edom were
Chief Timnah, Chief Alvah, Chief Jetheth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Chief Oholibamah, Chief Elah, Chief Pinon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Chief Kenaz, Chief Teman, Chief Mibzar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Chief Magdiel, and Chief Iram. These were the chiefs of Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These are the sons of Israel:
Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Judah were
Er, Onan, and Shelah: These three were born to him by the daughter of Shua the Canaanitess. Now Er, the firstborn of Judah, was evil in the sight of the Lord, and He put him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Tamar his daughter-in-law bore Perez and Zerah for him. In all, Judah had five sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Perez were
Hezron and Hamul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Zerah were
Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Kalkol, and Dara, five of them in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Karmi were
Achar, the troubler of Israel, who acted unfaithfully in regard to the ban.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The son of Ethan was
Azariah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now the sons of Hezron, who were born to him, were
Jerahmeel, Ram, and Kelubai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ram became the father of
Amminadab, and Amminadab became the father of Nahshon, a leader of the sons of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nahshon became the father of Salma, and Salma became the father of Boaz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Boaz became the father of Obed, and Obed became the father of Jesse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now Jesse became the father of
his firstborn Eliab, and Abinadab the second, and Shimea the third,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nethanel the fourth, Raddai the fifth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ozem the sixth, David the seventh;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. The sons of Zeruiah were Abishai, Joab, and Asahel, three in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abigail bore Amasa: the father of Amasa was Jether the Ishmaelite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Caleb the son of Hezron had children with his wife Azubah and with Jerioth. These are her sons: Jesher, Shobab, and Ardon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Azubah died, and Caleb took Ephrath as a wife. She bore Hur for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hur became the father of Uri, and Uri became the father of Bezalel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward Hezron had relations with the daughter of Makir, the father of Gilead, whom he took as a wife when he was sixty years old, and she bore Segub for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Segub became the father of Jair, who had twenty-three cities in the land of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took Geshur and Aram, the towns of Jair, from them, with Kenath and its villages, sixty towns. All these were descendants of Makir, the father of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the death of Hezron in Caleb Ephrathah, Hezron’s wife Abijah bore him Ashhur the father of Tekoa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now the sons of Jerahmeel the firstborn of Hezron were
Ram the firstborn, Bunah, Oren, Ozem, and Ahijah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jerahmeel also had another wife. Her name was Atarah, and she was the mother of Onam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Ram the firstborn of Jerahmeel were
Maaz, Jamin, and Eker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Onam were
Shammai and Jada.
And the sons of Shammai were
Nadab and Abishur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The name of the wife of Abishur was Abihail. She bore him Ahban and Molid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Nadab were
Seled and Appaim, but Seled died without children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The son of Appaim was
Ishi. The son of Ishi was Sheshan,
and the son of Sheshan was Ahlai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Jada the brother of Shammai were
Jether and Jonathan, but Jether died without children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Jonathan were
Peleth and Zaza.
These were the sons of Jerahmeel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now Sheshan had no children except daughters,
but he did have a servant, an Egyptian, whose name was Jarha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sheshan gave one of his daughters to Jarha his servant as a wife, and she bore him Attai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Attai became the father of Nathan,
and Nathan became the father of Zabad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Zabad became the father of Ephlal,
and Ephlal became the father of Obed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Obed became the father of Jehu,
and Jehu became the father of Azariah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Azariah became the father of Helez,
and Helez became the father of Eleasah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Eleasah became the father of Sismai,
and Sismai became the father of Shallum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shallum became the father of Jekamiah,
and Jekamiah became the father of Elishama.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now the sons of Caleb the brother of Jerahmeel were
Mesha his firstborn, who was the father of Ziph, and the sons of Mareshah the father of Hebron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Hebron were
Korah, Tappuah, Rekem, and Shema.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shema became the father of Raham, the father of Jorkeam, and Rekem became the father of Shammai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The son of Shammai was Maon, and Maon was the father of Beth Zur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ephah, Caleb’s concubine, bore Haran, Moza, and Gazez, and Haran became the father of Gazez.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Jahdai were
Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah, and Shaaph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Maakah, Caleb’s concubine, bore Sheber and Tirhanah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She also bore Shaaph the father of Madmannah, Sheva the father of Makbenah, and the father of Gibea. The daughter of Caleb was Aksah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These were the sons of Caleb the son of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah:
Shobal the father of Kiriath Jearim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Salma the father of Bethlehem, and Hareph the father of Beth Gader.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now sons were born to Shobal the father of Kiriath Jearim:
Haroeh and half of the Manahathites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The families of Kiriath Jearim were the Ithrites, the Puthites, the Shumathites, and the Mishraites. From these the Zorathites and the Eshtaolites went forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Salma were
Bethlehem, the Netophathites, Atroth Beth Joab, and half of the Manahathites, the Zorites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The families of the scribes who lived at Jabez were the Tirathites, the Shimeathites, and the Sucathites. They are the Kenites who came from Hammath, the father of the house of Rekab.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
the third was Absalom the son of Maakah, the daughter of Talmai king of Geshur;
the fourth, Adonijah the son of Haggith;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the fifth, Shephatiah by Abital;
the sixth, Ithream by Eglah his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Six sons were born to him in Hebron, and he reigned there seven years and six months.
He also reigned thirty-three years in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now these were born to him in Jerusalem:
Shimea, Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon, four sons by Bathsheba the daughter of Ammiel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then Ibhar, Elishama, Eliphelet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet, nine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were all the sons of David, besides the sons of the concubines, and Tamar their sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Solomon’s son was Rehoboam;
Abijah was his son,
Asa his son,
Jehoshaphat his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Joram his son,
Ahaziah his son,
Joash his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Amaziah his son,
Azariah his son,
Jotham his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ahaz his son,
Hezekiah his son,
Manasseh his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Amon his son,
and Josiah his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Josiah were
the firstborn Johanan,
the second Jehoiakim,
the third Zedekiah,
and the fourth Shallum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Jehoiakim were
Jeconiah his son
and Zedekiah his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Jeconiah were Assir,
Shealtiel his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Malkiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Pedaiah were
Zerubbabel and Shimei,
and the sons of Zerubbabel were
Meshullam and Hananiah,
and Shelomith was their sister;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Hashubah, Ohel, Berekiah, Hasadiah, and Jushab-Hesed, five.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Hananiah were
Pelatiah and Jeshaiah, the sons of Rephaiah, the sons of Arnan, the sons of Obadiah, and the sons of Shekaniah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Shekaniah were
Shemaiah and the sons of Shemaiah:
Hattush, Igal, Bariah, Neariah, and Shaphat, six in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Neariah were
Elioenai, Hizkiah, and Azrikam, three in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Elioenai were
Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah, and Anani, seven in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Judah were
Perez, Hezron, Karmi, Hur, and Shobal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Reaiah the son of Shobal became the father of Jahath, and Jahath became the father of Ahumai and Lahad. These are the families of the Zorathites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These were the sons of the father of Etam:
Jezreel, Ishma, and Idbash. The name of their sister was Hazzelelponi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Penuel was the father of Gedor, and Ezer was the father of Hushah.
These were the sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah, the father of Bethlehem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ashhur the father of Tekoa had two wives: Helah and Naarah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Naarah bore him Ahuzzam, Hepher, Temeni, and Haahashtari. These were the sons of Naarah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Helah were
Zereth, Zohar, and Ethnan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Koz became the father of Anub and Hazzobebah and the families of Aharhel the son of Harum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jabez was more honorable than his brothers, and his mother called his name Jabez, saying, “Because I bore him in hardship.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jabez called on the God of Israel, saying, “Oh, that You would indeed bless me and enlarge my territory, that Your hand might be with me, and that You would keep me from evil, that it may not bring me hardship!” So God granted what he asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kelub the brother of Shuhah became the father of Mehir, who was the father of Eshton.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eshton became the father of Beth Rapha, Paseah, and Tehinnah the father of Ir Nahash. These were the men of Rekah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Kenaz were
Othniel and Seraiah,
and the sons of Othniel were
Hathath and Meonothai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Meonothai became the father of Ophrah,
and Seraiah became the father of Joab,
the father of Ge Harashim, for they were craftsmen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Caleb the son of Jephunneh were
Iru, Elah, and Naam,
and the son of Elah was
Kenaz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Jehallelel were
Ziph, Ziphah, Tiria, and Asarel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Ezrah were
Jether, Mered, Epher, and Jalon, and Mered’s wife bore Miriam, Shammai, and Ishbah the father of Eshtemoa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His Judean wife bore Jered the father of Gedor, Heber the father of Soko, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah. So these were the sons of Bithiah the daughter of Pharaoh, whom Mered took.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of his wife Hodiah, the sister of Naham, were
the father of Keilah the Garmite and Eshtemoa the Maakathite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Shimon were
Amnon, Rinnah, Ben-Hanan, and Tilon.
And the sons of Ishi were
Zoheth and Ben-Zoheth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Shelah the son of Judah were
Er the father of Lekah, Laadah the father of Mareshah, the families of the house of workers of fine linen at Beth Ashbea;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jokim, the men of Kozeba, Joash, Saraph, who was lord in Moab, and Jashubi Lehem (these records are ancient).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were the potters, those dwelling at Netaim and Gederah (they dwelt there with the king for his work).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Simeon were
Nemuel, Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, Shaul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shallum his son, Mibsam his son, and Mishma his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Mishma were
Hammuel his son, Zakkur his son, and Shimei his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters, but his brothers did not have many sons, nor did all their family multiply as much as the sons of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now they dwelt in Beersheba, Moladah, and Hazar Shual
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as well as in Bilhah, Ezem, Tolad,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bethuel, Hormah, Ziklag,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beth Markaboth, Hazar Susim, Beth Biri, and Shaaraim. These were their cities until the reign of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their villages were Etam, Ain, Rimmon, Token, and Ashan, five cities in all,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and all the villages that were around these cities as far as Baal. Such are their inhabited cities, and those registered to them were
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meshobab, Jamlech, and Joshah the son of Amaziah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joel, and Jehu the son of Joshibiah, the son of Seraiah, the son of Asiel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elioenai, Jaakobah, Jeshohaiah, Asaiah, Adiel, Jesimiel, Benaiah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ziza the son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These mentioned by name were leaders in their families, and their fathers’ houses increased greatly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They went to the entrance of Gedor, as far as the east side of the valley, to seek pasture for their flocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There they found rich, good pasture, and the land was wide, quiet, and peaceful; for former inhabitants there belonged to Ham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the days of Hezekiah king of Judah, those written by name came and attacked their tents, along with the Meunites who were found there, and utterly destroyed them until this day. Then they dwelt there in their place because there was pasture for their flocks there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now some of them, namely five hundred men from the sons of Simeon, went to Mount Seir with Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah, and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi, as their captains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they struck down the rest of the Amalekites who had escaped. So they have dwelt there until this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel (for he was the firstborn, but since he defiled his father’s bed, his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph the son of Israel, so that the genealogy is not listed according to the birthright;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: though Judah prevailed over his brothers and a ruler came from him, yet the birthright belonged to Joseph),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel were
Hanok, Pallu, Hezron, and Karmi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Joel were
Shemaiah his son, Gog his son,
Shimei his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Micah his son,
Reaiah his son, Baal his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Beerah his son, whom Tiglath-Pileser the king of Assyria led into exile. He was a leader of the Reubenites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His brothers according to their families by the registration of their generations were
Jeiel, the first, and Zechariah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bela the son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel, who dwelt in Aroer, even as far as Nebo and Baal Meon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he dwelt toward the east as far as the entrance to the wilderness from the Euphrates, for their cattle were abundant in the land of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now in the days of Saul, they made war with the Hagrites, who fell by their hand, and they dwelt in their tents over all the eastern plains of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Gad dwelt opposite them in the land of Bashan as far as Salekah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joel was the first, Shapham the second, with Janai and Shaphat in Bashan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their brothers of their father’s house were
Michael, Meshullam, Sheba, Jorai, Jakan, Zia, and Eber, seven in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Abihail, the son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahi the son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, was the head of their father’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They dwelt in Gilead in Bashan, and in its towns, and in all the outlands of Sharon to the edge of their borders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of them were registered by genealogy in the days of Jotham king of Judah and in the days of Jeroboam king of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Reuben, and the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh numbered forty-four thousand seven hundred and sixty valiant men, men able to bear shield and sword, to shoot with a bow, and who were skillful in battle, who went to war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They made war with the Hagrites, namely Jetur, Naphish, and Nodab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were helped against them, and the Hagrites and all who were with them were delivered into their hand, for they cried to God in the battle, and He heard their prayer because they trusted in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They captured their livestock: fifty thousand of their camels, two hundred and fifty thousand sheep, two thousand donkeys, and one hundred thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So many fell slain, because the war was of God. And they dwelt in their place until the exile.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The children of the half-tribe of Manasseh also dwelt in the land. They increased from Bashan as far as Baal Hermon and Senir, even to Mount Hermon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the heads of their fathers’ houses: Epher, Ishi, Eliel, Azriel, Jeremiah, Hodaviah, and Jahdiel, mighty men of valor, men of reputation, and heads of their fathers’ houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were unfaithful to the God of their fathers and played the harlot after the gods of the peoples of the land, whom God had wiped out before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul the king of Assyria, even the spirit of Tiglath-Pileser king of Assyria, and he led the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh into exile and brought them to Halah, Habor, Hara, and to the river of Gozan to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Levi were
Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Kohath were
Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The children of Amram were
Aaron, Moses, and Miriam.
The sons of Aaron were
Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eleazar became the father of Phinehas, Phinehas the father of Abishua,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abishua the father of Bukki, and Bukki the father of Uzzi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Uzzi became the father of Zerahiah, and Zerahiah the father of Meraioth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meraioth became the father of Amariah, and Amariah father of Ahitub.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahitub became the father of Zadok, and Zadok father of Ahimaaz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahimaaz became the father of Azariah, and Azariah father of Johanan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Johanan became the father of Azariah (he was the one who ministered as a priest in the temple that Solomon built in Jerusalem).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Azariah became the father of Amariah, and Amariah the father of Ahitub.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahitub became the father of Zadok, and Zadok the father of Shallum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shallum became the father of Hilkiah, and Hilkiah the father of Azariah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Azariah became the father of Seraiah, and Seraiah of Jehozadak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehozadak went into exile when the Lord led Judah and Jerusalem into exile by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Levi were
Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These are the names of the sons of Gershom:
Libni and Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Kohath were
Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Merari were
Mahli and Mushi.
Now these are the families of the Levites according to their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of Gershom were
Libni his son, Jahath his son,
Zimmah his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Joah his son,
Iddo his son, Zerah his son,
and Jeatherai his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Kohath were
Amminadab his son, Korah his son,
Assir his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Elkanah his son,
Ebiasaph his son, Assir his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Tahath his son, Uriel his son,
Uzziah his son, and Shaul his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Elkanah were
Amasai and Ahimoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for Elkanah, the sons of Elkanah were Zophai his son,
Nahath his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Eliab his son,
Jeroham his son, and Elkanah his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Samuel were
the firstborn Joel and Abijah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Merari were
Mahli, Libni his son,
Shimei his son, Uzzah his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shimea his son, Haggiah his son,
and Asaiah his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the ones whom David appointed over the service of song in the house of the Lord, after the ark rested there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now they were ministering before the dwelling place of the tabernacle of meeting with singing until Solomon had built the house of the Lord in Jerusalem, and they were arranged by their order according to their service.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These are the ones standing in order with their sons.
Of the sons of the Kohathites were
Heman the singer,
the son of Joel, the son of Samuel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the son of Elkanah, the son of Jeroham,
the son of Eliel, the son of Toah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the son of Zuph, the son of Elkanah,
the son of Mahath, the son of Amasai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the son of Elkanah, the son of Joel,
the son of Azariah, the son of Zephaniah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the son of Tahath, the son of Assir,
the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath,
the son of Levi, the son of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His brother Asaph, the one standing at his right hand, was
Asaph the son of Berekiah, the son of Shimea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the son of Michael, the son of Baaseiah,
the son of Malkijah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the son of Ethni,
the son of Zerah, the son of Adaiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the son of Ethan, the son of Zimmah,
the son of Shimei,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the son of Jahath,
the son of Gershom, the son of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of the sons of Merari, their brothers, standing on the left hand was
Ethan the son of Kishi, the son of Abdi,
the son of Malluk,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the son of Hashabiah,
the son of Amaziah, the son of Hilkiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the son of Amzi, the son of Bani,
the son of Shemer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the son of Mahli,
the son of Mushi, the son of Merari,
the son of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their brothers the Levites also were appointed for all kinds of service to the tabernacle of the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Aaron and his sons were making sacrifices on the altar of the burnt offering and on the altar of incense for all the work of the Most Holy Place and to make atonement for Israel, according to all that Moses the servant of God had commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now these are the sons of Aaron:
Eleazar his son, Phinehas his son,
Abishua his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bukki his son,
Uzzi his son, Zerahiah his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Meraioth his son, Amariah his son,
Ahitub his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Zadok his son,
and Ahimaaz his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And these are their dwelling places according to their walled settlements in their territory, for they were given to them, namely to the sons of Aaron and to the families of the Kohathites, by lot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gave them Hebron in the land of Judah, and its surrounding outlands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the open fields of the city, and its villages, they gave to Caleb the son of Jephunneh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the sons of Aaron they gave the cities of Judah with the cities of refuge: Hebron and Libnah with its outlands, Jattir and Eshtemoa with their outlands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hilen with its outlands, Debir with its outlands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ashan with its outlands, and Beth Shemesh with its outlands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the tribe of Benjamin, they gave Geba with its outlands, Alemeth with its outlands, and Anathoth with its outlands.
All their cities throughout their families were thirteen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the sons of Kohath, those remaining from the family of that tribe, they gave ten cities by lot from half the tribe of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the sons of Gershon, throughout their families, they gave from the tribe of Issachar, from the tribe of Asher, from the tribe of Naphtali, and from the tribe of Manasseh in Bashan, thirteen cities in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the sons of Merari, throughout their families, they gave by lot from the tribe of Reuben, from the tribe of Gad, and from the tribe of Zebulun, twelve cities in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus, the sons of Israel gave cities with their outlands to the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gave by lot from the tribe of the sons of Judah, and from the tribe of the sons of Simeon, and from the tribe of the sons of Benjamin, these cities, which are called by their names.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some from the families of the sons of Kohath received cities for their territory from the tribe of Ephraim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They gave to them with the cities of refuge: Shechem in the mountains of Ephraim with its outlands, Gezer with its outlands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jokmeam with its outlands, Beth Horon with its outlands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aijalon with its outlands, and Gath Rimmon with its outlands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also the half-tribe of Manasseh gave Aner with its outlands and Bileam with its outlands for the remaining family of the sons of Kohath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the sons of Gershom, the family of the half-tribe of Manasseh gave Golan in Bashan with its outlands and Ashtaroth with its outlands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the tribe of Issachar, they received Kedesh with its outlands, Daberath with its outlands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ramoth with its outlands, and Anem with its outlands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the tribe of Asher, they received Mashal with its outlands, Abdon with its outlands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hukok with its outlands, and Rehob with its outlands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the tribe of Naphtali, they received Kedesh in Galilee with its outlands, Hammon with its outlands, and Kiriathaim with its outlands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the remaining sons of Merari, the tribe of Zebulun gave Rimmono with its outlands and Tabor with its outlands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then on the other side of the Jordan opposite Jericho, to the east of the Jordan, from the tribe of Reuben they were given Bezer in the wilderness with its outlands, Jahzah with its outlands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kedemoth with its outlands, and Mephaath with its outlands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And from the tribe of Gad, they received Ramoth in Gilead with its outlands, Mahanaim with its outlands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heshbon with its outlands, and Jazer with its outlands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now the sons of Issachar were
Tola, Puah, Jashub, and Shimron, four in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Tola were
Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Ibsam, and Samuel. They were heads of their father’s house. The sons of Tola were mighty men of valor in their generations. Their number in the days of David was twenty-two thousand six hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The son of Uzzi was
Izrahiah,
and the sons of Izrahiah were
Michael, Obadiah, Joel, and Ishiah, five chiefs in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With them, by their generations, after the house of their fathers, were thirty-six thousand troops of war, battle-ready, for they had many wives and sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now their brothers from all the families of Issachar were mighty men of valor, in all eighty-seven thousand registered by genealogy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Benjamin had
Bela, Beker, and Jediael, three sons in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Bela were five:
Ezbon, Uzzi, Uzziel, Jerimoth, and Iri. They were heads of their fathers’ houses, mighty men of valor, and registered by their genealogies, twenty-two thousand and thirty four in number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Beker were
Zemirah, Joash, Eliezer, Elioenai, Omri, Jeremoth, Abijah, Anathoth, and Alemeth. All these are the sons of Beker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now their registration according to their generations, heads of their fathers’ houses, mighty men of valor, was twenty thousand two hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The son of Jediael was
Bilhan,
along with the sons of Bilhan:
Jeush, Benjamin, Ehud, Kenaanah, Zethan, Tarshish, and Ahishahar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these sons of Jediael were heads of their fathers’ houses, mighty men of valor, numbering seventeen thousand two hundred soldiers, ready to go out to war for battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Shuppites and Huppites were the sons of Ir; the Hushites the sons of Aher.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Naphtali were
Jahziel, Guni, Jezer, and Shallum, descendants of Bilhah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Manasseh were
Asriel, whom his Aramean concubine bore. She also bore Makir the father of Gilead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now Makir took a wife for Huppim and Shuppim, whose sister’s name was Maakah.
The name of the second was Zelophehad, and Zelophehad had daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Maakah the wife of Makir bore a son, and she called his name Peresh. His brother’s name was Sheresh, and his sons were Ulam and Rakem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The son of Ulam was
Bedan.
These were the sons of Gilead, the son of Makir, the son of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His sister Hammoleketh bore Ishhod, Abiezer, and Mahlah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Shemida were
Ahian, Shechem, Likhi, and Aniam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Ephraim were
Shuthelah, Bered his son,
Tahath his son, Eleadah his son,
Tahath his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Zabad his son,
Shuthelah his son, and Ezer and Elead, whom the men of Gath born in that land killed because they came down to take their livestock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ephraim their father mourned many days, and his brothers came to comfort him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he went in to his wife, and she conceived and bore a son, so he called his name Beriah, because evil had been in his house
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (his daughter was Sheerah, who built both Lower and Upper Beth Horon as well as Uzzen Sheerah).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rephah was also his son, as were Resheph,
Telah his son, Tahan his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ladan his son, Ammihud his son,
Elishama his son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Nun his son,
and Joshua his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their possessions and settlements were Bethel and its towns, and to the east Naaran, and to the west Gezer with its towns, Shechem and its towns, and Ayyah and its towns;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: also along the borders of the Manassites, Beth Shan and its towns, Taanach and its towns, Megiddo and its towns, and Dor and its towns. In these lived the sons of Joseph the son of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now the children of Asher were
Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, Beriah, and their sister Serah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Beriah were
Heber and Malkiel, who was the father of Birzaith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heber became the father of Japhlet, Shomer, Hotham, and their sister Shua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Japhlet were
Pasak, Bimhal, and Ashvath.
These were the children of Japhlet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Shomer were
Ahi, Rohgah, Hubbah, and Aram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of his brother Helem were
Zophah, Imna, Shelesh, and Amal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Zophah were
Suah, Harnepher, Shual, Beri, Imrah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bezer, Hod, Shamma, Shilshah, Ithran, and Beera.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Jether were
Jephunneh, Pispah, and Ara.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Ulla were
Arah, Hanniel, and Rizia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were the children of Asher, heads of their fathers’ houses, choice men, mighty men of valor, and heads of the leaders. They were registered by their genealogy among the army fit for war. Their number was twenty-six thousand men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now Benjamin became the father of Bela his firstborn,
Ashbel the second, Aharah the third,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nohah the fourth, and Rapha the fifth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Bela were
Addar, Gera, Abihud,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abishua, Naaman, Ahoah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gera, Shephuphan, and Huram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the sons of Ehud, who were the heads of the fathers’ houses to those dwelling in Geba, and who exiled them to Manahath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he exiled Naaman, Ahijah, and Gera and then became the father of Uzza and Ahihud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shaharaim had sons in the country of Moab after he had sent away his wives Hushim and Baara.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had sons with his wife Hodesh, namely Jobab, Zibia, Mesha, Malkam,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeuz, Sakia, and Mirmah. These were his sons, heads of the fathers’ houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also had sons by Hushim: Abitub and Elpaal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Elpaal were
Eber, Misham, Shemed (he built Ono and Lod with its towns),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Beriah, and Shema, who were heads of the fathers’ houses to those dwelling in Aijalon and who drove out the inhabitants of Gath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as well as Ahio, Shashak, Jeremoth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zebadiah, Arad, Eder,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Michael, Ishpah, and Joha, the sons of Beriah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zebadiah, Meshullam, Hizki, Heber,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ishmerai, Izliah, and Jobab were the sons of Elpaal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jakim, Zikri, Zabdi,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elienai, Zillethai, Eliel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Adaiah, Beraiah, and Shimrath were the sons of Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ishpan, Eber, Eliel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Abdon, Zikri, Hanan,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hananiah, Elam, Anthothijah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Iphdeiah, and Penuel were the sons of Shashak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shamsherai, Shehariah, Athaliah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jaareshiah, Elijah, and Zikri were the sons of Jeroham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were heads of the fathers’ houses according to their generations, chief men who dwelt in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The father of Gibeon dwelt in Gibeon,
and Maakah was his wife’s name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His firstborn son was Abdon, along with Zur, Kish, Baal, Nadab,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gedor, Ahio, and Zeker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mikloth also became the father of Shimeah. Now these also dwelt in Jerusalem with their own families near their brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ner became the father of Kish; Kish the father of Saul; Saul the father of Jonathan, Malki-Shua, Abinadab, and Esh-Baal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jonathan’s son was
Merib-Baal, and Merib-Baal became the father of Micah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Micah were
Pithon, Melek, Tarea, and Ahaz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahaz became the father of Jehoaddah, and Jehoaddah became the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri. Zimri became the father of Moza,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moza became the father of Binea. Now Raphah was his son, Eleasah his son, and Azel his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Azel had six sons, and their names were
Azrikam, Bokeru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. All these were the sons of Azel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of his brother Eshek were
Ulam his firstborn, Jeush the second, and Eliphelet the third.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Ulam were mighty men of valor, even archers, and had many sons and grandsons, one hundred and fifty in all.
These were all the sons of Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all Israel was registered by genealogies, and these were written in the book of the kings of Israel. And Judah was led into exile to Babylon for their unfaithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the first ones to dwell in their possessions in their cities were children of Israel, priests, Levites, and temple servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the sons of Judah dwelt in Jerusalem alongside some of the sons of Benjamin, Ephraim, and Manasseh:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Uthai the son of Ammihud, the son of Omri, the son of Imri, the son of Bani, of the sons of Perez the son of Judah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
of the Shilonites:
Asaiah the firstborn and his sons;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
of the sons of Zerah:
Jeuel and their brothers, six hundred and ninety.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those of the sons of Benjamin were
Sallu the son of Meshullam, the son of Hodaviah, the son of Hassenuah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ibneiah the son of Jeroham; Elah the son of Uzzi, the son of Mikri; Meshullam the son of Shephatiah, the son of Reuel, the son of Ibnijah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their brothers according to their generations, nine hundred and fifty-six. All these men were heads of families according to their fathers’ houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those of the priests were
Jedaiah, Jehoiarib, Jakin;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Azariah the son of Hilkiah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Zadok, the son of Meraioth, the son of Ahitub, the head official of the house of God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Adaiah the son of Jeroham, the son of Pashhur, the son of Malkijah; Maasai the son of Adiel, the son of Jahzerah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Meshillemith, the son of Immer;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their brothers, heads of the houses of their fathers, one thousand seven hundred and sixty very able men for the work of the service of the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those of the Levites were
Shemaiah the son of Hasshub, the son of Azrikam, the son of Hashabiah, of the sons of Merari;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bakbakkar, Heresh, Galal, and Mattaniah the son of Mika, the son of Zikri, the son of Asaph;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Obadiah the son of Shemaiah, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun; Berekiah the son of Asa, the son of Elkanah, who lived in the villages of the Netophathites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now the gatekeepers were
Shallum, Akkub, Talmon, Ahiman, and their brothers (Shallum was the head officer
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who until then had served at the king’s eastern gate). They were the gatekeepers for the camps of the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shallum the son of Kore, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah, and his brothers from his father’s house, the Korahites, were over the work of the service, gatekeepers of the tabernacle. Their fathers had been over the camp of the Lord, guards at the entrance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Phinehas the son of Eleazar was the official over them in previous times, and the Lord was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zechariah the son of Meshelemiah was gatekeeper at the entrance to the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those chosen as gatekeepers were two hundred and twelve. They were registered by their genealogy in their villages. Now David and Samuel the seer established them in their trusted offices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they and their sons were in charge of the gates of the house of the Lord, that is, the house of the tabernacle, as guards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The gatekeepers were on four sides: east, west, north, and south.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their brothers in their villages were to come for seven days from time to time to serve with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in their trusted offices the four main gatekeepers who were Levites had charge over the chambers and treasuries of the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They spent the night around the house of God, for the watch was entrusted to them, and they were responsible for opening it every morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of them were in charge of the vessels of service, that they should bring them in and out by number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some others were appointed over the furnishings and all the implements of the sanctuary as well as the fine flour, the wine, the oil, the frankincense, and the spices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And some of the sons of the priests mixed the ointment of the spices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mattithiah, one of the Levites (he was the firstborn of Shallum the Korahite), was entrusted with making the flat cakes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others of the sons of the Kohathites and from their brothers were given charge over the showbread to prepare it every Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the singers, heads of the fathers’ houses of the Levites, who stayed in the temple chambers, free from other service, because they were occupied with the work day and night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the heads of the fathers’ houses of the Levites according to their generations, leaders, who dwelt in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now Jeiel the father of Gibeon,
whose wife’s name was Maakah, dwelt in Gibeon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His firstborn son was Abdon, then Zur, Kish, Baal, Ner, Nadab,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gedor, Ahio, Zechariah, and Mikloth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mikloth became the father of Shimeam. These also dwelt in Jerusalem with their own families near their brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ner became the father of Kish; Kish the father of Saul; Saul the father of Jonathan, Malki-Shua, Abinadab, and Esh-Baal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The son of Jonathan was
Merib-Baal, and Merib-Baal became the father of Micah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Micah were
Pithon, Melek, Tahrea, and Ahaz.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ahaz became the father of Jarah, and Jarah the father of Alemeth, Azmaveth, and Zimri. Zimri became the father of Moza,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Moza became the father of Binea, Rephaiah his son, Eleasah his son, and Azel his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Azel had six sons, and these were their names:
Azrikam, Bokeru, Ishmael, Sheariah, Obadiah, and Hanan. These were the sons of Azel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the Philistines fought against Israel, every Israelite fighter fled before the Philistines, and the slain fell on Mount Gilboa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Philistines pursued Saul and his sons and struck down Saul’s sons Jonathan, Abinadab, and Malki-Shua.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As the battle with Saul became heavy, the archers’ bows found their target and mortally wounded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So Saul said to his armor bearer, “Draw your sword and pierce me through lest these uncircumcised Philistines come and make a fool of me.”
But his armor bearer was unwilling to do it because he was overwhelmed with fear, so Saul took the sword and fell on it himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the armor bearer saw that Saul was dead, he too fell on his sword and died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus, Saul and his three sons, namely all his house, died together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when all the children of Israel in the valley saw that they had fled the battlefield, and Saul and his sons were dead, they abandoned their cities and escaped, leaving the Philistines to come and dwell in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day, when the Philistines came to pillage the slain, they found Saul and his sons fallen on Mount Gilboa.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they stripped Saul, removed his head and his armor, and circulated the news of his demise throughout the land of the Philistines to their idols as well as the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they placed his armor in the temple of their gods, while his head they impaled in the house of Dagon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now all Jabesh Gilead heard about everything the Philistines did to Saul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so their valiant men rose up and carried the body of Saul and the bodies of his sons to Jabesh. They buried their bones under the oak in Jabesh and fasted, mourning seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Saul died because of his unfaithful deeds against the Lord, because of his failure to keep the word of the Lord, and because he sought to consult a spirit of divination
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but did not seek the Lord. So He killed him and turned the kingdom over to David the son of Jesse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all Israel assembled before David at Hebron, saying, “We are your own people, even your flesh and blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also from times past until now, even when Saul was king, you were the one who led Israel going out and coming in, and the Lord your God said to you, Indeed, you will shepherd My people Israel as the ruler of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the elders of Israel came to King David at Hebron, and he made a covenant with them there before the Lord. So they anointed David king over Israel according to the word of the Lord delivered by Samuel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now David and all Israel with him went to Jerusalem (that is, Jebus, since the Jebusites still dwelt there in the land).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Jebusites said to David, “You will not come here,” but he captured the stronghold of Zion (it is the City of David).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now David had said, “Whoever strikes Jebus first will be the commander and leader of the army,” so Joab, the son of Zeruiah, went up first and became the commander.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David dwelt in the stronghold, which is why they called it the City of David,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he fortified the city all around from the Millo encircling the stronghold, while Joab preserved the rest of the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David kept on going, becoming greater and greater, and the Lord of Hosts was with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the heads of the mighty men whom David had, who strengthened him in his kingdom, along with all Israel, to establish him as king according to the word of the Lord to Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These make up the number of the mighty men who fought for David:
Jashobeam, the son of Hakmoni, the head of the thirty, who lifted his spear in triumph over three hundred slain at one time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After him was Eleazar, the son of Dodai the Ahohite, who was among the three mighty men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was with David at Pas Dammim when the Philistines were gathered there for battle. There was a piece of ground full of barley. Now the men fled from the Philistines.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they stood their ground in the middle of the field, defended it, and killed the Philistines; and the Lord saved them by a great victory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now three of the thirty captains climbed down the rock to David at the cave of Adullam while the camp of the Philistines was set up in the Valley of Rephaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (At that time, David was in the stronghold, but a garrison of the Philistines was in Bethlehem.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now David was overcome with longing and said, “Who will get me a drink of water from the well of Bethlehem by the gate?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These three broke through the Philistine camp, drew water from the well of Bethlehem by the gate, and carried it back to David. However, he was not willing to drink it but poured out the water to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he said, “Far be it from me before my God to do this. Should I drink the life blood of these men who put their lives in jeopardy? For at the risk of their lives they brought it.” Therefore he would not drink it.
The three mighty men did these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also Abishai himself, the brother of Joab, was a captain of the three who lifted his spear in triumph over three hundred slain and was given a name among the three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was honored as a leader by the second company of the three, but he did not attain to the first three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Benaiah son of Jehoiada was the son of a valiant man from Kabzeel, who had done many deeds. He killed two Moabite warriors. Indeed, once he went down into a well and struck a lion on a snowy day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he killed an Egyptian, a man of great stature, five cubits tall. The Egyptian had in his hand a spear like a weaver’s beam, and he went down to him with a staff, wrested the spear from the Egyptian’s hand, and killed him with his own spear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada, did these things, and won a name among the three mighty men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Out of the thirty captains, he himself was honored, and although he did not attain to the three, David set him over his guard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now the other mighty men of valor of the army were
Asahel the brother of Joab,
Elhanan the son of Dodo of Bethlehem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shammoth the Harorite,
Helez the Pelonite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite,
Abiezer the Anathothite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sibbekai the Hushathite,
Ilai the Ahohite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Maharai the Netophathite,
Heled the son of Baanah, the Netophathite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ithai the son of Ribai of Gibeah in Benjamin,
Benaiah the Pirathonite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hurai from the rivers of Gaash,
Abiel the Arbathite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Azmaveth the Baharumite,
Eliahba the Shaalbonite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the sons of Hashem the Gizonite,
Jonathan the son of Shagee, the Hararite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ahiam the son of Sakar, the Hararite,
Eliphal the son of Ur,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hepher the Mekerathite,
Ahijah the Pelonite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hezro the Carmelite,
Naarai the son of Ezbai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Joel the brother of Nathan,
Mibhar the son of Hagri,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Zelek the Ammonite,
Naharai the Berothite, the armor bearer of Joab, the son of Zeruiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ira the Ithrite,
Gareb the Ithrite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Uriah the Hittite,
Zabad the son of Ahlai,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Adina the son of Shiza, the Reubenite, a captain of the Reubenites, and thirty with him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hanan the son of Maakah,
Joshaphat the Mithnite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Uzzia the Ashterathite,
Shama and Jeiel the sons of Hotham, the Aroerite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jediael the son of Shimri and
Joha his brother, the Tizite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Eliel the Mahavite,
and Jeribai and Joshaviah the sons of Elnaam,
Ithmah the Moabite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eliel, Obed, and Jaasiel the Mezobaite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the men who came to David at Ziklag, while he yet kept himself away from Saul the son of Kish. They were among the brave men, helpers in the war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were armed with bows, and could use both the right hand and the left in hurling stones and shooting arrows out of a bow. They were Saul’s brothers of Benjamin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The chief was Ahiezer, then Joash, the sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite; Jeziel and Pelet the sons of Azmaveth; Berakah, and Jehu the Anathothite;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Ishmaiah the Gibeonite, a brave warrior among the thirty, and over the thirty; Jeremiah, Jahaziel, Johanan, and Jozabad the Gederathite;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Eluzai, Jerimoth, Bealiah, Shemariah, and Shephatiah the Haruphite;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Elkanah, Ishiah, Azarel, Joezer, and Jashobeam the Korahites;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Joelah and Zebadiah, the sons of Jeroham of Gedor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the Gadites mighty men of valor, men of the war battalion, who could handle shield and sword, whose faces were like the faces of lions, and who were as swift as the gazelles on the mountains, separated themselves for David in the stronghold in the wilderness:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ezer the captain,
Obadiah the second, Eliab the third,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mishmannah the fourth, Jeremiah the fifth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Attai the sixth, Eliel the seventh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Johanan the eighth, Elzabad the ninth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeremiah the tenth, Makbannai the eleventh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were from Gad, captains of the battalions. One of the least of them was as a hundred and the greatest as a thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the ones who crossed over the Jordan during the first month when it had overflowed its banks and caused the valley dwellers to flee to the east and to the west.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the sons of Benjamin and Judah came to the stronghold of David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David went out before them and said to them, “If you have come in peace to help me, then I will have a heart united with yours, but if to betray me to my adversaries, when there is no violence in my hand, may the God of our fathers see, and may He decide between us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Spirit came upon Amasai the captain of the officers, and he said,
“We are for you, David,
    and with you, son of Jesse.
Peace, peace to you,
    and peace to the one helping you,
        for your God helps you.”
So David welcomed them and appointed them as captains of the troops.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now some from Manasseh joined forces with David when he came with the Philistines for battle against Saul, but they did not help them. For after taking counsel, the lords of the Philistines sent him away, saying, “It will be our heads if he falls back to his lord Saul.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he went to Ziklag, these men of Manasseh deserted to join him: Adnah, Jozabad, Jediael, Michael, Jozabad, Elihu, and Zillethai, chiefs of thousands in Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they helped David against the bands of raiders because all of them were mighty men of valor and commanders in the army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For at that time, day by day, they came to help David until they became a great camp like the camp of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these make up the number of the leaders equipped for the battalion who came to David at Hebron in order to turn the kingdom of Saul over to him, as the mouth of the Lord had spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Judah who carried shields and spears: six thousand eight hundred equipped for war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the sons of Simeon, mighty men of valor, fit for war: seven thousand one hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the sons of the Levites: four thousand six hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehoiada was the principal leader of the Aaronites, and he brought with him three thousand seven hundred,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while Zadok, a brave young warrior, brought twenty-two leaders from the house of his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the sons of Benjamin, the brothers of Saul: three thousand (up to that time the greater number of them were keeping their loyalty with the house of Saul).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the sons of Ephraim: twenty thousand eight hundred mighty men of valor, men of reputation in the house of their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the half-tribe of Manasseh: eighteen thousand who were marked by name to come and crown David king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the sons of Issachar, those having understanding of times and what Israel should do: two hundred of their captains with all their brothers at their command.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of Zebulun, fifty thousand seasoned troops, equipped for battle with all the weapons of war, to help David with singleness of purpose. From Zebulun, those going out to war, equipped for battle with all the weapons of war, to help David with an undivided heart: fifty thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Naphtali: one thousand leaders and thirty-seven thousand with shields and spears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the Danites, competent for battle: twenty-eight thousand six hundred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Asher, those going out to war, arranged for battle: forty thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also from the other side of the Jordan, from the Reubenites, the Gadites, and half of the tribe of Manasseh with all their battle array: one hundred and twenty thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these made up the men of war, arranged in ranks, who came to Hebron with a sincere heart to make David king over all Israel, along with the all the rest of Israel who with one heart came to make David king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now all these were there with David three days, eating and drinking, for their brothers had made provisions for them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and also the ones who were as near to them as Issachar, Zebulun, and Naphtali were bringing bread on donkeys, on camels, on mules, and on oxen, food of fine flour, fig cakes, raisins, wine, oil, herds, and flocks in abundance, for there was joy in Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David conferred with the captains of the thousands and of the hundreds and with every leader.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to all the assembly of Israel, “If it seems good to you and to the Lord our God, let us send word to the rest of our brothers throughout all the land of Israel along with the priests and the Levites in their cities, that they might join us here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then let us bring the ark of the Lord our God back to us, for we did not seek it during the days of Saul.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the assembly agreed to do it because the thing seemed right in the eyes of all the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David assembled all Israel, from Shihor in Egypt as far as the entrance to Hamath, in order to bring the ark of God from Kiriath Jearim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he went up with all Israel to Baalah, that is, to Kiriath Jearim, which belongs to Judah, to bring up the ark of God, the Lord who dwells between the cherubim, where His name is called.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They transported the ark of God on a new cart from the house of Abinadab with Uzzah and Ahio driving the cart
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while David and all Israel played music before God with all their might, performing songs on lyres, harps, tambourines, cymbals, and trumpets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they had come as far as the threshing floor of Kidon, Uzzah stretched out his hand to take hold of the ark because the oxen had stumbled on the path.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the anger of the Lord burned against Uzzah, and He struck him because he reached his hand out to touch the ark. Thus, Uzzah died there before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now David was angry because the Lord struck out against Uzzah, so he called that place Perez Uzzah, as it is to this day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David was afraid of God that day, saying, “How can I ever bring the ark of God to myself?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David stopped moving the ark of God to himself in the City of David and diverted it to the house of Obed-Edom the Gittite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and while the ark of God stayed in his house three months, the Lord blessed the house of Obed-Edom and all he had.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Hiram the king of Tyre sent messengers to David with cedar wood, stonemasons, and carpenters to build a palace for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David knew that the Lord had established him as king over Israel because his kingdom was highly exalted for the sake of His people Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now David took more wives in Jerusalem, and David became the father of more sons and daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the names of the children who were born to him in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ibhar, Elishua, Elpelet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elishama, Beeliada, and Eliphelet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the Philistines heard that David had been anointed king over all Israel, all the Philistines went up to seek out David, but David heard and went out to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Philistines came and raided the Valley of Rephaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then David inquired of the Lord, saying, “Should I go up against the Philistines? Will You give them into my hand?”
The Lord answered, “Go up against them, and I will give them into your hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they went up to Baal Perazim, and David struck them down there. Then David said, “God broke through my enemies by my hand as the breaking through of waters.” Therefore they named that place Baal Perazim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They abandoned their gods there, and David said that they should be burned with fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Philistines raided the valley once more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David again inquired of God, and God answered him: “Do not go up after them, but turn around behind them and come to them in front of the balsam trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the balsam trees, you will advance the battle, for God has gone out before you to strike the camp of the Philistines.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David did just as God commanded him, and they struck the camp of the Philistines from Gibeon as far as Gezer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the fame of David went out in all the lands, and the Lord put the dread of him on all the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David built houses for himself in the City of David, and he prepared a place for the ark of God and pitched a tent for it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said, “No one may carry the ark of God except the Levites since the Lord chose them to carry the ark of the Lord and to minister before Him always.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David assembled all Israel to Jerusalem in order to bring up the ark of the Lord to the place he had prepared for it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And David gathered representatives of the sons of Aaron and the Levites, as follows:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
from the sons of Kohath,
Uriel the leader and one hundred and twenty of his brothers;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
from the sons of Merari,
Asaiah the leader and two hundred and twenty of his brothers;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
from the sons of Gershom,
Joel the leader and one hundred and thirty of his brothers;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
from the sons of Elizaphan,
Shemaiah the leader and two hundred of his brothers;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
from the sons of Hebron,
Eliel the leader and eighty of his brothers;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
from the sons of Uzziel,
Amminadab the leader and one hundred and twelve of his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David called for Zadok and Abiathar the priests and for the Levites: Uriel, Asaiah, Joel, Shemaiah, Eliel, and Amminadab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to them, “You are the captains of the fathers’ houses for the Levites. Consecrate yourselves, you and your brothers, so you may bring up the ark of the Lord, the God of Israel, to the place I have prepared for it
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because on the first attempt without you the Lord struck out against us since we did not seek Him properly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the priests and the Levites consecrated themselves to bring up the ark of the Lord, the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of the Levites lifted up the ark of God just as Moses commanded, with the poles on their shoulders, according to the word of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David told the leaders of the Levites to position their brothers the singers with musical instruments, harps, lyres, and cymbals to resound with joyful songs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Levites placed Heman the son of Joel, and from his brothers, Asaph the son of Berekiah, and from their brothers the sons of Merari, Ethan the son of Kushaiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and with them their brothers of the second rank: Zechariah, Ben, Jaaziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Benaiah, Maaseiah, Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom, and Jeiel, the gatekeepers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the singers, Heman, Asaph, and Ethan, were directed to sound cymbals of brass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zechariah, Aziel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Unni, Eliab, Maaseiah, and Benaiah were to accompany with harps on Alamoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mattithiah, Eliphelehu, Mikneiah, Obed-Edom, Jeiel, and Azaziah were to lead with lyres on the Sheminith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Kenaniah, leader of the Levites, was to conduct the music because he was skillful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Berekiah and Elkanah were gatekeepers for the ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shebaniah, Joshaphat, Nethanel, Amasai, Zechariah, Benaiah, and Eliezer, the priests, were assigned to sound trumpets before the ark of God. Obed-Edom and Jehiah were gatekeepers for the ark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David, the elders of Israel, and the leaders of the thousands went to bring up the ark of the covenant of the Lord from the house of Obed-Edom with rejoicing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since God helped the Levites who carried the ark of the covenant of the Lord, they sacrificed seven bulls and seven rams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now David was clothed in a fine linen robe, as were the Levites who carried the ark, the singers, and Kenaniah, the conductor of singing and singers. David himself wore a linen ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So all Israel brought up the ark of the covenant of the Lord with a shout and with the sound of the ram’s horn and with trumpets and cymbals, making music on harps and lyres.
verses.speaker: Narrator
