verses.text: Now as the ark of the covenant of the Lord was entering the City of David, Michal the daughter of Saul was looking down from the window, and when she saw King David dancing and spinning, she despised him in her heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they brought in the ark of God, placed it in the midst of the tent that David had erected for it, and drew near to God with burnt offerings and peace offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When David had finished offering the burnt offerings and the peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he distributed to all the children of Israel, both men and women, a loaf of bread, a piece of meat, and a raisin cake for each.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he appointed some of the Levites to minister before the ark of the Lord, to commemorate, to thank, and to praise the Lord God of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Asaph the chief, and next to him Zechariah, then Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, and Obed-Edom: Jeiel with stringed instruments and harps, but Asaph made music with the cymbals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests sounded trumpets continually before the ark of the covenant of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day then, David delivered for the first time this psalm of thanksgiving to the Lord into the hand of Asaph and his brothers:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give thanks to the Lord, call on His name;
    make known His deeds among the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to Him, sing praise to Him,
    recount all His wonders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Glory in His holy name;
    let the heart of those who seek the Lord rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Seek the Lord and His strength;
    seek His face continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember His wonders which He has done,
    His wonders and the judgments of His mouth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O seed of Israel, His servant,
    O sons of Jacob, His chosen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is the Lord our God;
    His judgments are in all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember His covenant forever,
    the word He commanded for a thousand generations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that He made with Abraham,
    even His oath to Isaac.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He confirmed it to Jacob as a statute,
    to Israel for an everlasting covenant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan
    as the portion of your inheritance.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you were few in number,
    few indeed, and strangers there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when they wandered from nation to nation,
    from one kingdom to another,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He allowed no man to oppress them;
    He rebuked kings on their account,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
saying, “Do not touch My anointed,
    and do My prophets no harm.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sing to the Lord, all the earth.
    Proclaim good tidings of His salvation from day to day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Declare His glory among the nations,
    His wonders among all the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For great is the Lord and greatly to be praised.
    He is to be feared above all gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For all the gods of the peoples are idols,
    but the Lord made the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Honor and majesty are before Him;
    strength and joy are in His place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give to the Lord, O families of the peoples,
    give to the Lord glory and strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Tremble before Him, all the earth.
    The world also is firmly established; it shall not be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the heavens rejoice, and let the earth be glad.
    Let them say among the nations, “The Lord is King.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the sea roar, and all its fullness.
    Let the field rejoice, and all that is in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the trees of the forest will ring out before the Lord,
    for He is coming to judge the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh, give thanks to the Lord, for He is good;
    for His mercy endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now say, “Save us, O God of our salvation,
    and gather us and deliver us from the nations,
that we may give thanks to Your holy name,
    to glory in Your praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the Lord, the God of Israel,
    from everlasting to everlasting.”
Then all the people said, “Amen,” and “Praise the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he left Asaph and his brothers before the ark of the covenant of the Lord to minister before the ark regularly, as each day required,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and also Obed-Edom and his sixty-eight brothers, while Obed-Edom, the son of Jeduthun, and Hosah were to be gatekeepers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he left Zadok the priest and his priestly brothers before the tabernacle of the Lord at the high place that was at Gibeon
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to offer burnt offerings to the Lord on the altar of burnt offering continually, morning and evening, according to all that was written in the Law of the Lord, which He commanded Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With them were Heman and Jeduthun and the rest who were chosen, who were marked by name to give thanks to the Lord, for His mercy endures forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heman and Jeduthun had with them trumpets and cymbals to sound aloud and instruments for sacred song. The sons of Jeduthun were appointed to the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the people departed, each man to his house, and David returned to bless his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened as David dwelt in his house that he said to Nathan the prophet, “Here I am dwelling in a house of cedar while the ark of the Lord is under curtains.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Nathan said to David, “Do all that is in your heart, for God is with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it happened on that same night that the word of the Lord came to Nathan, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Go and tell David My servant: Thus says the Lord: You will not build a house for Me to dwell in,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I have not dwelt in a house since the day when I brought Israel up even until this day, but I have gone from tent to tent and from tabernacle to tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Wherever I have gone in all Israel, have I ever spoken a word to the any of the judges of Israel that I commanded to shepherd My people, saying, Why have you not built Me a house of cedar?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now say this to My servant David: Thus says the Lord of Hosts: I took you from the pasture, from following after the flock, to be ruler over My people Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I have been with you wherever you went, and I have cut off all your enemies from before you. Also I will make your name like the names of the greatest on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will appoint a place for My people Israel, and I will plant them there where they will dwell securely and tremble no more, so that the sons of wickedness will not oppress them just as before
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
from the time when I commanded the judges of My people Israel. I will subdue all your enemies.
And I declare to you the Lord will build a house for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then it will be when your days are full and you go to your fathers, I will raise up your seed after you from your own sons. His kingdom I will establish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is the one who will build Me a house, and I will establish his throne forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will be a father to him, and he will be a son to Me. I will not take away My favor from him as I did from the one who was before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will assign him a place in My house and in My kingdom forever, and his throne will be established for all time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus, Nathan spoke to David all these words and according to all this vision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then King David came and sat before the Lord, and he said,
“Who am I, O Lord God, and what is my house that You have brought me this far?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was something small in Your eyes, God, but You have spoken concerning the house of Your servant for a great while to come and have regarded me with the status of a great man, O Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What more can David speak to You for the honor of Your servant? For You know Your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Lord, for the sake of Your servant and according to Your own heart You have done all these great things and made known all these great things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “O Lord, there is none like You, and there is no god besides You as we have heard with our ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is like Your people Israel, a nation on earth whom God has redeemed for Himself as a people to make for Yourself a great name by great and awesome deeds in driving out nations from before Your people whom You redeemed from Egypt?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For You made Your people Israel for Yourself for a people forever, and You, O Lord, have become their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And now, Lord, the word which You have spoken concerning Your servant and concerning his house, let it endure forever and do just as You have spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let Your name endure and be magnified forever, saying, ‘The Lord of Hosts, the God of Israel, is God to Israel.’ And let the house of David Your servant be established before You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For You, my God, have revealed to Your servant that You will build a house for him. Therefore Your servant has found courage to pray before You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, O Lord, You are God, and You have promised this good word to Your servant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, You have been pleased to bless the house of Your servant that it may be forever before You. For You, O Lord, have blessed it, and it shall be blessed forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened after this that David attacked the Philistines and subdued them, so he took Gath and its neighboring towns from Philistine control.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also defeated Moab so that the Moabites became servants to David and brought tribute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Next David struck down Hadadezer the king of Zobah toward Hamath as he marched out to establish his authority along the Euphrates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David captured from him one thousand chariots, seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand infantry men. Then David hamstrung all the chariot horses except for the one hundred he spared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Arameans of Damascus came to help Hadadezer king of Zobah, David struck down twenty-two thousand Arameans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David set garrisons in Aram of Damascus; and Arameans became subject to David, and brought tribute. The Lord gave victory to David wherever he went.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David took the shields of gold that were on the servants of Hadadezer, and brought them to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also from Tibhath and Kun, cities of Hadadezer, David took a large amount of bronze; with it Solomon made the bronze Sea, the pillars, and the vessels of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Tou king of Hamath heard that David had defeated all the army of Hadadezer king of Zobah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he sent his son Hadoram to King David to ask about his welfare and to bless him because he fought and defeated Hadadezer (for Hadadezer had been at war with Tou). He sent all kinds of articles of gold, silver, and bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King David also dedicated these to the Lord, together with the silver and gold which he had carried away from all the surrounding nations, from Edom, Moab, the Ammonites, the Philistines, and Amalek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also Abishai the son of Zeruiah struck down eighteen thousand men of Edom in the Valley of Salt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He set up garrisons in Edom, and all the Edomites became servants to David. Wherever he went, the Lord gave David victory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David was king over all Israel, and he executed justice and righteousness for all his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joab the son of Zeruiah was over the army, and Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was the historian.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Zadok the son of Ahitub and Abimelek the son of Abiathar served as priests, while Shavsha was scribe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Kerethites and the Pelethites, and the sons of David were the king’s principal officials.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it happened after this that Nahash the king of the Ammonites died, and his son reigned in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said, “I will show kindness to Hanun the son of Nahash, because his father showed kindness to me.” So David sent messengers to comfort him concerning his father. And David’s servants came to Hanun in the land of the Ammonites to comfort him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the leaders of the Ammonites said to Hanun, “Do you think that David is honoring your father because he sent consolers? Have not his servants come to you to search and to overthrow and to spy out the land?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Hanun took the servants of David, shaved them, cut their garments in half as far as the hip, and sent them away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some came and told David about the men, so he sent to meet them, for the men were greatly humiliated. The king said, “Remain in Jericho until your beards grow full, and then return.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Ammonites saw that they had become a stench to David, Hanun and the Ammonites sent one thousand talents of silver to hire chariots and horsemen from Aram Naharaim, Aram Maakah, and Zobah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they hired for themselves thirty-two thousand chariots, with the king of Maakah and his people. They camped before Medeba as the Ammonites gathered from their cities to go out to war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When David heard of it, he sent Joab and all the army of the mighty men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Ammonites went out and formed ranks for battle at the entrance to the city while the kings who had come were by themselves in the open country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Joab saw the battle line was drawn in front of him and behind him, he chose some of the best men in Israel and arrayed them against the Arameans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest of the people he placed in the charge of his brother Abishai, and they took up positions to engage the Ammonites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “If the Arameans are too strong for me, then you will come help me, but if the Ammonites are too strong for you, I will come help you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Take courage, and let us prove worthy of our people and the cities of our God. May the Lord do what seems right to Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joab and the people who were with him drew near to the Arameans for battle, and they fled before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Ammonites saw the Arameans fleeing, they also fled before Abishai his brother and entered the city. So Joab returned to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Arameans saw that they had been defeated by Israel, they sent messengers and summoned the Arameans who were beyond the River, and Shophak, the commander of Hadadezer’s army went before them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When David was told about it, he gathered all Israel, crossed over the Jordan, and came against them. He divided his ranks and prepared to engage the Arameans in battle, so they fought against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Arameans fled before Israel, and David killed seven thousand chariot drivers and forty thousand infantry men of the Arameans, and killed Shophak, the commander of the army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And when the servants of Hadadezer saw that they were defeated before Israel, they negotiated peace with David and served him.
So the Arameans were not willing to aid the Ammonites in battle again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now at the beginning of the year when kings would go out to war, Joab led the army and devastated the land of the Ammonites. He came and besieged Rabbah. But David remained in Jerusalem. So Joab struck Rabbah and overthrew it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David took the crown of their king from his head and found it weighed about a talent of gold with a precious stone set in it. And it was placed on David’s head. He also brought out a great abundance of plunder from the city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He brought out the people who were it in, and put them to work with saws, sharp iron tools, and axes. Thus David did to all the cities of the Ammonites, and then he and all the people returned to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now after this, when war broke out in Gezer with the Philistines, Sibbekai of Hushah killed Sippai, who was one of the descendants of the giants, and they were humbled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again there was war with the Philistines, and Elhanan the son of Jair killed Lahmi, the brother of Goliath the Gittite, the shaft of whose wooden spear was like a weaver’s beam.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet again there was war at Gath, where there was a man of great stature, who had six fingers on each hand and six toes on each foot, twenty-four in number; and he also was descended from the giants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he taunted Israel, Jonathan the son of Shimea, David’s brother, killed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were descended from the giants in Gath, and they fell by the hand of David and his servants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Satan stood against Israel and incited David to number Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said to Joab and the leaders of the people, “Go count Israel from Beersheba to Dan and bring me a report, that I may know their number.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Joab said, “May the Lord increase the number of His people one hundred times more. My lord the king, are not all of them my lord’s servants? Why then should my lord require this? Why should it bring guilt on Israel?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, the king’s word prevailed against Joab, so Joab departed and went throughout all Israel. Then he returned to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joab gave the results of the census of the people to David: All Israel had one million one hundred thousand men who drew the sword, and in Judah four hundred and seventy thousand men drew the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, he did not include the Levites and Benjamin because the word of the king was abhorrent to Joab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this thing was evil in the sight of God, and He struck Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David said to God, “I have sinned greatly in doing this thing. Now, please, take away the iniquity of your servant, for I have acted very foolishly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Lord spoke to Gad, David’s seer, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go and speak to David, ‘Thus says the Lord: Three things I offer you; choose one of these for yourself that I may do to you.’ ”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Gad came to David and said to him, “Thus says the Lord, ‘Select for yourself,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: either three years of famine, or three months of being swept away before your foes while the sword of your enemy overtakes you, or three days of the sword of the Lord, even pestilence in the land, with the angel of the Lord destroying throughout all the territory of Israel.’ Now then consider what answer I shall return to Him who sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David replied to Gad, “I am in great distress. Let me fall into the hands of the Lord, for His mercies are very great, but do not let me fall into the hand of man.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord sent a plague throughout Israel, and seventy thousand men of Israel fell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And God sent an angel to Jerusalem to destroy it, but as he prepared to destroy it, the Lord looked and relented from the calamity. And He said to the angel bringing the destruction, “It is enough. Remove your hand.” The angel of the Lord was then standing by the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David lifted up his eyes and saw the angel of the Lord standing between earth and heaven with his sword drawn in his hand stretched out over Jerusalem. So David and the elders, covered in sackcloth, fell on their faces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to God, “Was it not I who gave the command to number the people? I am the one who has sinned and surely done evil. But these sheep, what have they done? O Lord my God, I pray, let Your hand be against me and my father’s house, but do not let Your people be plagued.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel of the Lord commanded Gad to tell David that David should go up and raise an altar to the Lord on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David went up at the word of Gad which he delivered in the name of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Ornan turned and saw the angel, but his four sons who were with him hid themselves as Ornan threshed the wheat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As David came to Ornan, Ornan looked and saw David and went out from the threshing floor and bowed down before David with his face to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said to Ornan, “Give me the site of the threshing floor so that I may build an altar on it to the Lord. Sell it to me at full price so the plague on the people may be restrained.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Ornan replied to David, “Take it for yourself, and let my lord the king do whatever seems good in his eyes. Look, I will give the oxen for the burnt offerings, the threshing wagons for wood, and the wheat for the grain offering. I will give it all.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then King David said to Ornan, “No, for I will surely acquire it for the full price, for I will not take what is yours for the Lord nor offer burnt offerings that cost me nothing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David gave Ornan six hundred shekels of gold by weight for the site,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and David built there an altar to the Lord and offered up burnt offerings and peace offerings. He called on the Lord, and the Lord answered him by fire from heaven on the altar of burnt offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Lord spoke to the angel, and he put away his sword in its sheath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time, when David saw that the Lord had answered him at the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite, he sacrificed there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the tabernacle of the Lord and the altar of burnt offering that Moses had made in the wilderness were in the high place in Gibeon at that time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But David was unable to go before it to inquire of God, because he was terrified by the sword of the angel of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said, “Here shall be the house of the Lord God and here the altar of the burnt offering for Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So David gave instructions to gather together those sojourning in the land of Israel, and he appointed stonemasons to cut hewn stones for building the house of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David also provided large quantities of iron for nails for the doors of the gates and for the clamps as well as an abundance of bronze beyond measure,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and cedar logs without number, for the Sidonians and the Tyrians brought much cedar wood to David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now David said, “Solomon my son is young and inexperienced, and the house that is to be built for the Lord must be exceedingly magnificent, of fame and glory throughout all the lands. Therefore I will make preparation for it now.” So David made extensive preparations before his death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David called Solomon his son and commanded him to build a house for the Lord, the God of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David said to Solomon, “My son, I had it in my heart to build a house for the name of the Lord my God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the word of the Lord came to me, saying, ‘You have shed much blood and waged great wars. You shall not build a house for My name because you have shed much blood on the earth before Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A son shall be born to you who shall be a man of rest. I will give him rest from all his enemies all around. Solomon will be his name, and I will give peace and tranquility to Israel in his days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will be the one to build a house for My name. He shall be a son to Me, and I will be a father to him, and I will establish the throne of his kingdom over Israel forever.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now, my son, may the Lord be with you, and may you have success in building the house of the Lord your God just as He has spoken concerning you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Only may the Lord give you insight and understanding and give you charge over Israel so you may keep the law of the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will prosper if you carefully observe the statutes and the judgments which the Lord commanded Moses for Israel. Be strong and of good courage. Do not be afraid or dismayed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “With great difficulty I have prepared for the house of the Lord one hundred thousand talents of gold and one million talents of silver as well as innumerable quantities of bronze and iron, beyond measure. I have also prepared timber and stone to which you may add even more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover you have an abundance of workers: stonecutters, masons, carpenters, and men skilled in all kinds of work,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: craftsmen in gold, silver, bronze, and iron without number. Rise up and work, and may the Lord be with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David commanded all the leaders of Israel to assist Solomon his son, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Is not the Lord your God with you? Has He not given you rest all around? For He has given the inhabitants of the land into my hand, and the land is subdued before the Lord and His people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now dedicate your heart and your soul to seek the Lord your God. Rise up and build the sanctuary of the Lord God, so that you may bring the ark of the covenant of the Lord along with the holy vessels of God into the house which is to be built for the name of the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now David was old and full of days when he made Solomon his son king over Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he gathered together all the leaders of Israel with the priests and the Levites.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Levites from thirty years old and up were counted, and their head count of men was thirty-eight thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Twenty-four thousand of these, David said, “shall have charge of the work in the house of the Lord; six thousand shall be officers and judges,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: four thousand shall be gatekeepers, and four thousand shall offer praises to the Lord with the instruments that I have made for praise.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: David assigned them to divisions according to the sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the Gershonites:
Ladan and Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Ladan were
first Jehiel, then Zetham and Joel, three in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Shimei were
Shelomith, Haziel, and Haran, three.
These were the heads of the fathers’ houses of Ladan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Shimei were
Jahath, Zina, Jeush, and Beriah.
These four were the sons of Shimei.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jahath was the first and Ziza the second, but Jeush and Beriah did not have many sons, so they were counted as one unit for their father’s house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Kohath were
Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel, four in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Amram were
Aaron and Moses,
but Aaron was set apart to consecrate the most holy things, he and his sons forever, to offer sacrifices before the Lord, to minister to Him, and to bless in His name forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for Moses, the man of God, his sons were named among the tribe of Levi.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Moses were
Gershom and Eliezer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The son of Gershom was
Shubael the chief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The son of Eliezer was
Rehabiah the chief.
Eliezer had no other sons, but the sons of Rehabiah were very many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The son of Izhar was
Shelomith the chief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Hebron were
Jeriah the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Uzziel were
Micah the first and Ishiah the second.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Merari were
Mahli and Mushi.
The sons of Mahli were
Eleazar and Kish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eleazar died having no sons, but only daughters, so the sons of Kish, their brothers, took them as wives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Mushi were
Mahli, Eder, and Jerimoth, three.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the sons of Levi according to their fathers’ houses, the heads of the fathers’ houses as they were registered by the number of their names according to their head count, those doing the work for the service of the house of the Lord, from twenty years old and up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For David said, “The Lord, the God of Israel, has given rest to His people, and He dwells in Jerusalem forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so the Levites no longer need to carry the tabernacle and all its implements for its service.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For by the last words of David, the sons of Levi were numbered from twenty years old and up;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because their duty was to help the sons of Aaron in the service of the house of the Lord, in the courts and in the chambers, with the purifying of all holy things, even the work of service of the house of God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and with the showbread, the fine flour for a grain offering, the wafers of unleavened bread, the baked offering, the offering mixed with oil, and all measures of quantity and size,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to stand morning by morning to thank and praise the Lord, and likewise in the evening,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to offer up all burnt offerings to the Lord, for Sabbaths, New Moons, and appointed feasts, by number as the judgment concerning them, continually before the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that they should keep charge of the tent of meeting and the sanctuary and attend to the sons of Aaron, their brothers, for the service of the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now the divisions of the sons of Aaron were these.
The sons of Aaron: Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Nadab and Abihu died before their father, and they had no sons. So Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David, along with Zadok of the sons of Eleazar and Ahimelek of the sons of Ithamar, divided them to their offices by their service.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since the sons of Eleazar were found to have more chief men than the sons of Ithamar, they divided them into sixteen heads of the fathers’ houses for the sons of Eleazar, and eight for the sons of Ithamar, according to their fathers’ houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they divided them by lots, the one as the other, for there were officers of the sanctuary and officers of God among both the sons of Eleazar and Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shemaiah the son of Nethanel, the Levite scribe, wrote them down in the presence of the king, the leaders, Zadok the priest, Ahimelek the son of Abiathar, and the heads of the fathers’ houses of the priests and the Levites, one father’s house taken for Eleazar and one for Ithamar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The first lot fell to Jehoiarib,
the second to Jedaiah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the third to Harim,
the fourth to Seorim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the fifth to Malkijah,
the sixth to Mijamin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the seventh to Hakkoz,
the eighth to Abijah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the ninth to Jeshua,
the tenth to Shekaniah,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the eleventh to Eliashib,
the twelfth to Jakim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the thirteenth to Huppah,
the fourteenth to Jeshebeab,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the fifteenth to Bilgah,
the sixteenth to Immer,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the seventeenth to Hezir,
the eighteenth to Happizzez,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the nineteenth to Pethahiah,
the twentieth to Jehezkel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the twenty-first to Jakin,
the twenty-second to Gamul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the twenty-third to Delaiah,
the twenty-fourth to Maaziah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were their appointments for their service to come into the house of the Lord according to the schedule prescribed for them by Aaron their father, as the Lord God of Israel had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For Rehabiah: from the sons of Rehabiah,
the first was Ishiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the Izharites, Shelomoth;
from the sons of Shelomoth, Jahath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Hebron: Jeriah the first, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Uzziel, Micah;
from the sons of Micah, Shamir.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The brother of Micah, Ishiah;
from the sons of Ishiah, Zechariah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Merari, Mahli and Mushi;
the son of Jaaziah, Beno.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Merari:
by Jaaziah were Beno, Shoham, Zakkur, and Ibri.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Mahli: Eleazar, who had no sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Kish: the son of Kish,
Jerahmeel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sons of Mushi: Mahli, Eder, and Jerimoth.
These were the sons of the Levites according to their fathers’ houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These also cast lots just as their brothers, the sons of Aaron, in the presence of David the king, Zadok, Ahimelek, and the heads of the fathers’ houses of the priests and of the Levites, the head of the fathers’ houses as well as his younger brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David and the officers of the army also set apart for the service some of the sons of Asaph, and of Heman, and of Jeduthun, those who prophesied with lyres, harps, and cymbals. The number of those who did the work according to their service was:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the sons of Asaph:
Zakkur, Joseph, Nethaniah, and Asarelah, the sons of Asaph under the guidance of Asaph, who prophesied according to the decree of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Jeduthun, the sons of Jeduthun:
Gedaliah, Zeri, Jeshaiah, Hashabiah, and Mattithiah, six, under the guidance of their father Jeduthun, who prophesied with the lyre in giving thanks and praise to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Heman, the sons of Heman:
Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shubael and Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, and Romamti-Ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, Mahazioth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were the sons of Heman, the king’s seer, according to the words of God, to exalt him, for God gave fourteen sons and three daughters to Heman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were under the direction of their father for the music in the house of the Lord with cymbals, harps, and lyres, for the service of the house of God by decree of the king: Asaph, Jeduthun, and Heman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the number of them, with their brothers, who were trained in singing to the Lord, all of whom were skillful, was two hundred and eighty-eight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They cast lots for their duties, small and great, teacher and student alike.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
the third to Zakkur,
his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the fourth to Izri,
his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the fifth to Nethaniah,
his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the sixth to Bukkiah,
his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the seventh to Jesarelah,
his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the eighth to Jeshaiah,
his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the ninth to Mattaniah,
his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the tenth to Shimei,
his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the eleventh to Azarel,
his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
the twelfth to Hashabiah,
his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the thirteenth to Shubael,
his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the fourteenth to Mattithiah,
his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the fifteenth to Jerimoth,
his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the sixteenth to Hananiah,
his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the seventeenth to Joshbekashah,
his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the eighteenth to Hanani,
his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the nineteenth to Mallothi,
his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the twentieth to Eliathah,
his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the twenty-first to Hothir,
his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the twenty-second to Giddalti,
his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the twenty-third to Mahazioth,
his sons and his brothers, twelve;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the twenty-fourth to Romamti-Ezer,
his sons and his brothers, twelve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These were the divisions of the gatekeepers:
from the Korahites, Meshelemiah the son of Kore, one of the sons of Asaph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Meshelemiah had sons:
Zechariah the firstborn,
Jediael the second,
Zebadiah the third,
Jathniel the fourth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Elam the fifth,
Jehohanan the sixth,
and Eliehoenai the seventh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Obed-Edom had sons:
Shemaiah the firstborn,
Jehozabad the second,
Joah the third,
Sakar the fourth,
Nethanel the fifth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ammiel the sixth,
Issachar the seventh,
and Peullethai the eighth
(for God blessed him).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also to his son Shemaiah sons were born who ruled their fathers’ houses, for they were men of great ability.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Shemaiah were Othni, Rephael, Obed, and Elzabad, whose brothers were able men: namely Elihu and Semakiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All these were of the sons of Obed-Edom with their sons and their brothers, able men qualified for service, sixty-two of Obed-Edom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meshelemiah had sons and brothers, able men, eighteen in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also Hosah, of the sons of Merari, had sons: Shimri the first (although he was not the firstborn, his father made him the first),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hilkiah the second, Tabaliah the third, Zechariah the fourth: all the sons and brothers of Hosah, thirteen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These divisions of the gatekeepers, for their chief men, had assignments to minister in the house of the Lord just as their brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They cast lots, small and great alike, according to their fathers’ houses, gate by gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The lot for the East Gate fell to Shelemiah. Then they cast lots for Zechariah his son, a wise counselor, and his lot came out for the North Gate;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to Obed-Edom the South Gate, and to his sons was allotted the storehouse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Shuppim and Hosah the lot came out for the West Gate, at the Shalleketh Gate on the ascending road, guard corresponding to guard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the east there were six Levites each day, on the north four each day, on the south four each day, as well as two and two at the storehouse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the colonnade on the west, there were four at the highway, and two at the colonnade.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These were the divisions of the gatekeepers of the sons of Korah and of the sons of Merari.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And of the Levites, Ahijah was over the treasures of the house of God, and over the treasures of the dedicated offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Ladan, the sons of the Gershonites, belonging to Ladan, the heads of the fathers’ houses belonging to Ladan the Gershonite: Jehieli.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sons of Jehieli, Zetham, and Joel his brother, were in charge of the treasures of the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the Amramites, the Izharites, the Hebronites, and the Uzzielites:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shubael the son of Gershom, the son of Moses, was ruler of the treasures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His brothers by Eliezer were Rehabiah his son, Jeshaiah his son, Joram his son, Zikri his son, and Shelomith his son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This Shelomith and his brothers were in charge of all the treasures of the dedicated offerings, which David the king, the heads of the fathers, the officers of the thousands and the hundreds, and the commanders of the army had dedicated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the spoils won in battles they dedicated for the maintenance of the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also all that Samuel the seer and Saul the son of Kish and Abner the son of Ner and Joab the son of Zeruiah had dedicated—all dedicated gifts were in the care of Shelomith and his brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the Izharites, Kenaniah and his sons were assigned the outside duties for Israel, as officers and judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From the Hebronites: Hashabiah and his brothers, one thousand seven hundred able men, were administrators of Israel on the west side of the Jordan for all the work of the Lord and for the service of the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jeriah was chief of the Hebronites according to the genealogical records of his fathers. In the fortieth year of the reign of David, mighty men of valor were found in the records among the Hebronites at Jazer of Gilead,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and his brothers, able men, two thousand seven hundred heads of the fathers, to them King David entrusted all matters of God and of the king concerning the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now these are the sons of Israel according to their number, the heads of fathers’ houses, the commanders of thousands and hundreds, and their officers who ministered to the king in all matters concerning the divisions, which came and went, month by month throughout all the months of the year, to each division of twenty-four thousand:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jashobeam the son of Zabdiel led the first division for the first month; in his division, twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was from the sons of Perez and was the leader of all the officers of the army for the first month.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dodai the Ahohite and his division led the division of the second month with Mikloth as the ruler: in his division, twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The third commander of the army for the third month was Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, a chief priest: in his division, twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Benaiah himself was the mighty man of the thirty who led the thirty: Ammizabad his son led his division.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fourth for the fourth month, Asahel the brother of Joab, and Zebadiah his son after him: in his division, twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fifth for the fifth month, the leader Shamhuth the Izrahite: in his division, twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sixth for the sixth month, Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite: in his division, twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventh for the seventh month, Helez the Pelonite, from the sons of Ephraim: in his division, twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eighth for the eighth month, Sibbekai the Hushathite, of the Zerahites: in his division, twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ninth for the ninth month, Abiezer the Anathothite, of the Benjamites: in his division, twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The tenth for the tenth month, Maharai the Netophathite, of the Zerahites: in his division, twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The eleventh for the eleventh month, Benaiah the Pirathonite, from the sons of Ephraim: in his division, twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The twelfth for the twelfth month, Heldai the Netophathite, of Othniel: in his division, twenty-four thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
over the Levites, Hashabiah the son of Kemuel;
over the Aaronites, Zadok;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
over Judah, Elihu, one of the brothers of David;
over Issachar, Omri the son of Michael;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
over Zebulun, Ishmaiah the son of Obadiah;
over Naphtali, Jerimoth the son of Azriel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
over the sons of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Azaziah;
over the half-tribe of Manasseh, Joel the son of Pedaiah;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
over the half-tribe of Manasseh in Gilead, Iddo the son of Zechariah;
over Benjamin, Jaasiel the son of Abner;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
over Dan, Azarel the son of Jeroham.
These were the leaders of the tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But David did not take the number from twenty years old and under because the Lord had said He would multiply Israel as the stars of the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joab the son of Zeruiah began to count them, but he did not finish. And because of this wrath came on Israel, and the number was not recorded in the account of the chronicles of King David.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Azmaveth the son of Adiel was over the king’s treasures, and Jonathan the son of Uzziah was over the storehouses in the fields, in the cities, and in the villages, and in the towers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ezri the son of Kelub was over those who did the work of the field to till the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shimei the Ramathite was over the vineyards, and Zabdi the Shiphmite was over what was in the vineyards for the stores of wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Baal-Hanan the Gederite was over the olive trees and the sycamore trees that were in the Shephelah, and Joash was over the stores of oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Shitrai the Sharonite was over the herds that fed in Sharon, and Shaphat the son of Adlai was over the herds that were in the valleys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Obil the Ishmaelite was over the camels, and Jehdeiah the Meronothite was over the donkeys.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jaziz the Hagrite was over the flocks.
All these were the overseers of King David’s property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also Jonathan, David’s uncle, was a counselor, a man of understanding, and a scribe; and Jehiel the son of Hakmoni was with the king’s sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Ahithophel was the king’s counselor, and Hushai the Arkite was the king’s friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jehoiada the son of Benaiah and Abiathar came after Ahithophel, and Joab was the leader of the king’s army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now David assembled all the leaders of Israel in Jerusalem: the leaders of the tribes, the officers of the divisions of those ministering to the king, the captains of thousands and the captains of hundreds, the stewards over all the property and livestock of the king and his sons with the eunuchs and the fighting men and all the brave warriors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So King David rose to his feet and said, “Hear me, my brothers and my people. I had it in my heart to build a house of rest for the ark of the covenant of the Lord, a footstool for the feet of our God, so I prepared to build it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But God said to me, ‘You shall not build a house for My name because you are a man of war and have spilled much blood.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Still, the Lord God of Israel chose me from all my father’s house to be king over Israel forever; for He chose Judah as leader, and in the house of Judah, the house of my father, and among the sons of my father, He took pleasure in me to make me king over all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of all my sons (for the Lord has given me many sons), He has chosen my son Solomon to sit on the throne of the kingdom of the Lord over Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For He said to me, ‘Solomon your son is the one who shall build My house and My courts, for I have chosen him to be My son, and I will be his Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will establish his kingdom forever if he is fully committed to keep My commandments and My judgments as it is this day.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now therefore in the sight of all Israel, the assembly of the Lord, and in the hearing of our God, observe and seek out all the commandments of the Lord your God, that you may possess this good land and leave it for an inheritance for your children after you forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for you, Solomon my son, know the God of your fathers and serve Him with a whole heart and with a willing spirit, for the Lord searches every heart and understands the intent of every thought. If you seek Him, He will be found by you, but if you forsake Him, He will abandon you forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See now that the Lord chose you to build the house for His sanctuary. Be strong and do it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David gave to Solomon his son the building plans for the vestibule of the temple, its house, its treasury, its roof chambers, its inner rooms, and the place of the mercy seat;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the plans, all of which were given to him by the Spirit, for the courts of the house of the Lord and for the surrounding rooms, the storehouses of the house of God, and the storehouses of the dedicated offerings;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the divisions of the priests and the Levites for all the work of the service of the house of the Lord and for all the implements of the service of the house of the Lord;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the weight of gold for all the golden implements of service, the implements of silver by weight for all implements of service,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the weight of the golden lampstands and their lamps, the weight of gold for each lampstand and its lamps, the weight of silver for a lampstand and its lamps according to the use of each lampstand;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the weight of gold for the tables of the showbread, table by table, and silver for the tables of silver;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the pure gold forks, the basins, and the pitchers; for the golden bowls with the weight for each bowl; the weight of silver for each silver dish;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the altar of incense, refined gold by weight; also his plan for the golden chariot of the cherubim that spread their wings and covered the ark of the covenant of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “All this,” said David, “the Lord made me understand in writing by His hand upon me, all the works of this pattern.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said to Solomon his son, “Be strong and courageous, and take action. Do not be afraid nor be dismayed for the Lord God, my God, is with you. He will not leave you nor forsake you, until you have finished all the work of the service of the house of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, here are the divisions of the priests and the Levites for all the service of the house of God, and all those who are willing and skillful for all the work will be with you for all the service; also the leaders and the people will be wholly at your command.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: King David said to all the assembly, “Solomon my son, the one whom God has chosen, is young and inexperienced, and the work is great since the palace is not for a man but for the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So with all my might I have prepared for the house of my God: gold for the things of gold, silver for the things of silver, bronze for the things of bronze, iron for the things of iron, and wood for the things of wood, along with onyx stones and stones for setting, stones of antimony, multicolored stones, and every precious stone, even alabaster in abundance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, in my devotion to the house of my God I have offered from my own property, gold and silver, which I give for the house of my God, over and above that which I prepared for the holy dwelling place:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: three thousand talents of gold of the gold of Ophir and seven thousand talents of refined silver for overlaying the walls of the house;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: of gold for the things of gold and of silver for the things of silver, even for all the handiwork of the craftsmen. Now, who is willing to consecrate himself today to the Lord?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the leaders of the fathers’ houses, the leaders of the tribes of Israel, the captains of thousands and hundreds, and the officials of the king’s workers offered willingly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also they donated to the service of the house of God five thousand talents of gold and ten thousand darics of gold, ten thousand talents of silver, eighteen thousand talents of bronze, and one hundred thousand talents of iron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever had precious stones gave them to the treasury of the house of the Lord in the custody of Jehiel the Gershonite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people rejoiced because they had offered willingly, for with a whole heart they had offered freely to the Lord; and King David also rejoiced greatly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So David blessed the Lord in the presence of all the assembly, and David said,
“Blessed are You, O Lord,
    the God of Israel,
    our Father forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yours, O Lord, is the greatness, and the power,
    and the glory, and the victory, and the majesty,
    for everything in the heavens and the earth is Yours.
Yours is the kingdom, O Lord,
    and You exalt Yourself as head above all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Riches and honor flow from You,
    and You rule over all.
In Your hand are power and might,
    and in Your hand it is to make great and to strengthen all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So now, our God, we give thanks to You,
    and praise Your glorious name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But who am I, and who are my people, that we should be able to offer so freely as this? For everything comes from You, even from Your own hand we have given to You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we are strangers and sojourners before You, just as all our fathers were. Our days on earth are like a shadow, and there is no hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Lord our God, all this abundance that we have prepared to build You a house for Your holy name has come from Your hand, and all belongs to You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know, my God, that You test the heart, and with uprightness You are pleased, so in the uprightness of my heart I have offered freely all these things, and now I have seen Your people, those present here, offer freely and joyously to You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: O Lord, the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, our fathers, keep this forever in the thoughts and intentions of the heart of Your people and direct their heart to You.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grant to Solomon my son a whole heart to keep Your commandments, Your testimonies, and Your statutes, to do all these things and to build the palace for which I have made preparation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then David said to all the assembly, “Bless now the Lord your God.” So all the assembly blessed the Lord, the God of their fathers. They bowed down and paid homage to the Lord and the king.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the following day, they made sacrifices to the Lord and offered burnt offerings to the Lord: one thousand bulls, one thousand rams, and one thousand lambs, with their drink offerings and sacrifices in abundance for all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they ate and drank before the Lord on that day with great joy.
And they made Solomon the son of David king a second time, for they anointed him to the Lord as a ruler and Zadok as a priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Solomon sat on the throne of the Lord as king instead of David his father, and he prospered, and all Israel obeyed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the leaders and the mighty men, and also the sons of King David, pledged their allegiance to King Solomon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord highly exalted Solomon in the sight of all Israel and bestowed on him such royal majesty as had never been on any king in Israel before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now David son of Jesse reigned over all Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His tenure as king over Israel was forty years: In Hebron, he reigned seven years, and in Jerusalem he was king thirty-three years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he died at a good old age, full of days, riches, and honor. And Solomon his son reigned in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the acts of David the king, first to last, are written in the book of Samuel the seer, and in the book of Nathan the prophet, and in the book of Gad the seer
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with all his reign and his might and the times that overtook him, and Israel, and all the kingdoms of the lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator
